page.title: 11Alrewas Mill
page.content: This dates back to 1614 in parts, but most of the building is from 1785 when a water powered cotton mill was here. It has been an animal feedstuff mill since the early 19th century and was bought by Midland Pig Producers Ltd. in 1976. They trade as M.P.P. Ltd. here. The company has 20,000 bacon pigs at units throughout Staffordshire and the mill makes 250 tonnes of feed per week. The mill operates for 6 days a week from 7 am. to 6 pm. There are 3 lorry drivers, 8 male mill workers and 2 female office workers. Production is powered by electricity. Part of the outbuildings are sub-let to Trent Insulations Ltd. The feed is delivered in bulk to the pig units in 18 tonne lorries. Some other feed is made in small quantities.
